title: Why is Google required to watch us like a hawk? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q: Why is Google required to watch us like a hawk? A: Because that is how Google makes their billions in profits every year Google is actually an advertising companyThey make billions in profits by watching you like hawk, creating a personality profile on youThey they bombard you with targeted advertising as well as selling your personality to other companies that pay huge sums for your personalityGoogle Faces $5 Billion Lawsuit For Collecting User Information via Chrome's Incognito ModeE.U. Fines Google $5.1 Billion in Android Antitrust Case (Published 2018)Google hit with $3 billion lawsuit in UK over YouTube data harvesting | AppleInsiderGoogle Fined Record $2.7 Billion in E.U. Antitrust Ruling (Published 2017)Europe hits Google with a third, $1.7 billion antitrust fineAustralian regulator files privacy suit against Google alleging location data misuseFrench lawsuit accuses Google of violating EU privacy rulesU.S. states lean toward breakup of Google's ad tech businessU.S. DOJ says Google breakup may be needed to end violations of antitrust lawThe Justice Department is reportedly preparing to file antitrust charges against GoogleMicrotargeted Ads Abuse Your Privacy for Nothing - TidBITSU.S. DOJ cites Apple deal in antitrust charges against Alphabet's GoogleU.S. DOJ says Google breakup may be needed to end violations of antitrust law

I hate to break it to you, but tracking our online activity isn’t a Google thing - it’s an advertising thing. This is how advertisers determine how to best target their potential customers. Nobody is watching you, “like a hawk.”
